headline: CarMax pops on Q1 earnings: The journey to catch up to Carvana
summary: CarMax (KMX) stock gains after reporting an earnings beat driven by strong demand for used vehicles. Wedbush Securities managing director of equity research Scott Devitt outlines the results and the used car retailer's efforts to catch up to Carvana (CVNA). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Why Is CarMax (KMX) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
summary: Shares of used automotive vehicle retailer Carmax (NYSE:KMX) jumped 5.8% in the afternoon session after the company reported impressive fiscal first-quarter 2026 results, which beat analysts' same-store sales and gross margin expectations. This led to nice EPS outperformance versus Wall Street's estimates. Growth was driven by a ramp in volumes of retail used and wholesale vehicles sold. Overall, this was a solid quarter, showing management is executing as expected.

content.title: Why Is CarMax (KMX) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
content.summary: Shares of used automotive vehicle retailer Carmax (NYSE:KMX) jumped 5.8% in the afternoon session after the company reported impressive fiscal first-quarter 2026 results, which beat analysts' same-store sales and gross margin expectations. This led to nice EPS outperformance versus Wall Street's estimates. Growth was driven by a ramp in volumes of retail used and wholesale vehicles sold. Overall, this was a solid quarter, showing management is executing as expected.

content.title: Top Stock Movers Now: Kroger, CarMax, Accenture, and More

thumbnail.caption: Parker Puls / Bloomberg via Getty Images Kroger was the best-performing stock in the S&P 500 as the biggest U.S. grocer beat profit and same-store sales and raised its same-store sales guidance on higher pharmacy, fresh food, and e-commerce sales.

headline: CarMax's Q1 Sales Go Into Overdrive
summary: CarMax saw a huge jump in sales, benefiting from a combination of rising momentum and the fact that used cars aren't subject to tariffs.  CEO Bill Nash hailed the efforts the company has made to adopt technology and digital capabilities in order to take advantage of a highly fragmented market.  CarMax is investing in capacity expansion to capitalize on demand.

CarMax is investing in capacity expansion to capitalize on demand.

headline: CarMax shares surge on strong Q1 earnings beat
summary: Investing.com -- CarMax Inc. shares jumped 7.2% in premarket trading on Friday after the used car retailer reported first-quarter earnings that easily topped Wall Street expectations, driven by higher sales volumes and strong profit margins.

content.title: CarMax shares surge on strong Q1 earnings beat
content.summary: Investing.com -- CarMax Inc. shares jumped 7.2% in premarket trading on Friday after the used car retailer reported first-quarter earnings that easily topped Wall Street expectations, driven by higher sales volumes and strong profit margins.

headline: CarMax’s (NYSE:KMX) Q2 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations, Stock Soars
summary: Used automotive vehicle retailer Carmax (NYSE:KMX) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 6.1% year on year to $7.55 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.38 per share was 18.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: CarMax’s (NYSE:KMX) Q2 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations, Stock Soars
content.summary: Used automotive vehicle retailer Carmax (NYSE:KMX) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 6.1% year on year to $7.55 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.38 per share was 18.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: S&P Futures Gain as Trump Delays Decision on Iran Strikes
summary: June S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESM25) are trending up +0.15% this morning as cash trading resumed after the Juneteenth holiday, with investors digesting the White House’s signal that President Trump would delay a decision to launch strikes against Iran.

content.title: S&P Futures Gain as Trump Delays Decision on Iran Strikes
content.summary: June S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESM25) are trending up +0.15% this morning as cash trading resumed after the Juneteenth holiday, with investors digesting the White House’s signal that President Trump would delay a decision to launch strikes against Iran.
